title: Bring delta support to OneDrive/Sharepoint remote
body:
<!--

If it still isn't there, here is a checklist of things to do:

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

https://forum.rclone.org/t/possible-listr-support-for-onedrive-sharepoint/41832/4?u=jcastill

#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

1.64.0

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

Currently OneDrive does not support ListR, yet it seems that implementing delta (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/concepts/scan-guidance?view=odsp-graph-online) would allow for ListR to be functional on the remote. This would help a lot specially as Microsoft is very conservative on TPSLimit before throttling so a list command of a large folder structure can easily trigger a throttle event.

Seems delta also supports single files/sub folders so it does not need to always scan the whole drive (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/driveitem-delta?view=graph-rest-1.0&tabs=http)

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

This can be used when --fast-list is invoked to scan the whole subfolder in less API calls in lieu of using more RAM. This can also be used for polling once a scan is completed, not sure if it would only work if initial scan is used by delta, in which case it might make sense to make it default for the remote as it's part of Microsoft API best practices.
